The 2012-13 GHS Scottie Academic Quick Recall Team completed a stellar season this year by competing in the High School National Quiz Tournament in Atlanta on this past Saturday and Sunday.

The team that competed included Seniors Jared Thompson and Tyler Reid along with Griffin Botts and Olivia Kiser. The tournament consisted of 256 teams from across the U.S. GHS earned a 5-5 record on Saturday which qualified the team for the small school playoffs on Sunday. On Sunday, the team went 2-2 to finish 7-7 on the weekend and placed #7 in the nation in the small school division. Overall, the team finished #105 out of 256 (up from 130 out of 240 last year).

In addition, Olivie Kiser was named to the "Sophomores to look for" team by having the 4th highest tossup average for Sophomores in the entire tournament.

This past weekend was a very successful time for the Glasgow High Track team. The boys relay teams in the 4X100 and 4X200 became state champions.

The 4X100 team consisted of Quental Bradley, Milas Norris, Garry Settles, and Julius Shirley.

The 4X200 broke the previous state set last year by the Glasgow and this team consisted of Quental Bradley, Milas Norris, Garry Settles, and Zack Wheeler.

Zack Wheeler finished 3rd in the state in the 400 meter dash.

Katlan Bradley finished 4th in the state in the 100 meter hurdles.

Garry Settles finished 4th in the state the 100 & 200 meter dash.

The girls 4X100 relay team which consisted of Katlan Bradley, Ashlyn Brown, Hydeia Depp, and Chasity Roberts finished 8th in the state.

Hydeia Depp competed in the 200 meter dash and finished 17th in the state.

Abriana Page had a strong showing in the girls high jump.

Congratulations to all the state competitors and their coaches John Vaughn, Anne Hodges, and David Bailey!

The History Bowl Team consisting of Jared Thompson, Tyler Reid, Olivia Kiser, Jacob Cooper and Caleb Barfield competed in the National History Bowl and Bee Saturday and Sunday against students from over 130 high schools from 31 states. All teams had to qualify by placing in the top 2 or 3 at a regional tournament. Our students qualified by winning the Western Kentucky Regional back in January.

The team finished in a tie for 9th in the nation after compiling a 10-2 record with wins over teams from New York, Georgia, Alabama, West Virginia, Florida, Massachussetts, California, New Jersey and Michigan. The two losses recorded by the team were to the eventual 2nd and 3rd place teams and perennial national contenders LASA out of Texas and Dorman, South Carolina.

Additionally, Olivia Kiser placed 20th out of over 150 freshmen and sophomores in the History Bee today while Jared Thompson placed 40th out of 170 students. Congratulations to them as well.

Way to go Scotties!
